member.name: T:TingenWebService.TingenWebService
member.summary: The entry class for the Tingen Web Service.

remarks.note:
This class doesn't do much actual work, and should remain fairly static.
For the most part, it just hands information toOutpost31, where the
heavy lifting is done.
There are two methods in this class, both of which are required
by Avatar:
remarks.para:
While you're here, take a look at this stuff:
The Tingen Documentation
TheTingen Web Service API Documentation

member.name: P:TingenWebService.TingenWebService.ExeAsm
member.remarks: A required component for writing log files, defined here so it can be used throughout the class.

member.name: P:TingenWebService.TingenWebService.TngnWbsvVersion
member.remarks: The version number is pulled from Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs

member.name: M:TingenWebService.TingenWebService.GetVersion
member.summary: Get the current version of Tingen.
member.returns: The current version number of Tingen.

remarks.note:
This method is required by Avatar and should not be modified.
Trace Logs can't go here because the logging infrastructure
hasn't been initialized yet.
For more information on the Tingen Web Service version
number, please see the TngnVersion property.

member.name: M:TingenWebService.TingenWebService.RunScript(ScriptLinkStandard.Objects.OptionObject2015,System.String)
member.summary: The entry point for the Tingen Web Service.
member.remarks:
This method is required by Avatar and should not be modified.
Trace Logs can't go here because the logging infrastructure
hasn't been initialized yet.
For more information on the Tingen Web Service version
number, please see theTngnVersion property.
This method logs critical events if the input parameters are invalid and debug-level events during the script execution process. Ensure that both and are valid before calling this method.
member.param: The instance containing the data to be processed by the script.
A string representing the script parameter to be used during execution. Cannot be null, empty, or whitespace.
member.returns: An instance representing the result of the script execution. If the input parameters are invalid, a default with no changes is returned.
